ğŸš€ RightsCon 2025. A Call to Action & Collective Resistance ğŸ”¥

As RightsCon 2025 comes to a close, I am filled with gratitude, urgency, and a renewed commitment to collective action. Over the past four days, we have gathered as a community of activists, technologists, policymakers, and advocates, confronting the challenges that threaten our movementâ€”from digital authoritarianism to funding freezes that are reshaping the digital rights landscape.

ğŸŒ Overcoming Differences, Strengthening Our Movement
Many of us began our journeys in grassroots activismâ€”in the streets, in classrooms, in communities fighting for justice. I, too, started at the grassroots, and I stand here today as Executive Director of Access Now because of the collective power of this movement.

But we cannot ignore the growing threats to our ecosystem:
âš ï¸ The funding crisis has been at the heart of our conversations this week.
âš ï¸ Organizations under attack are struggling to advocate for themselves without facing severe repression.
âš ï¸ External forces seek to divide us, pushing us into survival mode instead of collaboration.

ğŸ’œ Thank You to the RightsCon Community
To every activist, advocate, technologist, donor, volunteer, and frontline defenderâ€”this week was possible because of you. Your resilience, collaboration, and refusal to back down inspire me daily.

ğŸ”— The work does not end hereâ€”it continues in every battle for digital rights, in every demand for accountability, in every voice that refuses to be silenced. Letâ€™s move forward together.
